content.description:
Dr. Courlas conducts sleep research and studies the amount of time participants spend in different stages of sleep. The data are shown in the table.

Time Spent in Different Stages of Sleep

Participant

Minutes in Stages 1 and 2

Minutes in Stage 3

Minutes in REM Sleep

A

208

87

105

B

220

84

108

C

214

89

111

D

228

92

116

E

227

90

119
content.question: Which of the following most accurately describes the data in the table?

choices.label: The median time spent in stages 1 and 2 is 214 minutes.
The mode time spent in REM sleep is 111 minutes.
The range of time spent in stages 1 and 2 is 20 minutes.
The mean time spent in stage 3 is 9 minutes.

content.answer: The range of time spent in stages 1 and 2 is 20 minutes.

skill.text: 3.B: Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency, variation, and percentile rank in a given data set.
